init.error.winmute.platform-support.text: If Windows XP support is needed, please download WinMute version 1.4.2 or lower.
general.error.audio-service-shutdown.tit: The audio service has been shut down.
general.error.audio-service-shutdown.tex:
WinMute is not able to recover from that condition.
Please try to restart the program.

Bluetooth muting will be disabled on this computer.

WLAN is not available or disabled.
WLAN muting will be disabled on this computer.

popup.volume-restored.text: All endpoints have been restored to their previous configuration
popup.muting-workstation.title: Muting computer

popup.error.quiet-hours-start.text: Failed to register quiet hours start with windows timer system

settings.title: Settings
settings.bluetooth.add-edit.enter-device: Please enter a Bluetooth device name
settings.bluetooth.description:
"Bluetooth Muting" allows disabling the audio if an audio-class bluetooth device is disconnected, and re-enables it if a device is reconnected to the computer.

This behaviour can be enabled for all bluetooth audio-devices or only for a specific set.
settings.bluetooth-disabled-info:
Note: Bluetooth is not available on this device.
Some options have been disabled.
settings.mute.mute-with-restore.title: Mute with volume restore, when...
settings.mute.mute-without-restore.title: Mute without volume restore, when...
settings.mute.mute-without-restore.when-: ... WinMute is started within a RDP session
settings.quiet-hours.intro: During Quiet Hours WinMute automatically mutes the computers audio endpoints and unmutes them afterwards.
settings.quiet-hours.force-unmute-descri: If force unmute is enabled, WinMute will unmute the computers audio endpoints when quiet hours end and not take into account if they were already muted before quiet hours started.
settings.quiet-hours.error.invalid-time-: Start and stop must not be the same time.
settings.quiet-hours.error.error-while-s: Failed to save quiet hours settings
Something went wrong while saving the settings
settings.wifi.intro: "WLAN Mute" mutes the computer based on the name of the connected wireless network.
settings.wifi.mute-when-not-in-list:
Mute computer if the WLAN network name is NOT in the list
(default: mute if it is on the list)
settings.wifi.wifi-disabled-info:
Note: WLAN is not available on this device.
Some options have been disabled.
settings.mute.manage-endpoints.title: Manage audio endpoints
about.title: About WinMute
about.general.description: WinMute is developed by Alexander Steinhoefer his spare time. The code as well as new releases for this tool can be found on GitHub. Contributions in the form of code, tickets or feature requests are very welcome. Thanks for using this little tool!
